text: Gusuryak by Choi Seok-jeong, published in 1700 Choi Seok-jeong (; 1646–1715) was a Korean politician and mathematician in the Joseon period of Korea. He published the Gusuryak () in 1700, which is the first literature on the Latin square, predating Leonhard Euler by at least 67 years. He also invented the hexagonal tortoise problem. ==References== Category:Korean mathematicians Category:1646 births Category:1715 deaths
title: Choi Seok-jeong
